value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered. value.title: DAX Fridays! #29: HASONEVALUE
value.excerpt: Have you ever got this error message?: A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected ?  If you have, make sure to check out this video to understand how to solve it.  HASONEVALUE is a DAX function that will check if the table returned has one value or not. If it has, it will

value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column. value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. We will do two examples, how to substitute one value for another and how to substitute multiple values. value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. It is very useful for solving issues with many to many relationships and performance issues.  Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #7: ALL, ALLEXCEPT
value.excerpt: The function ALL returns all the rows in a table, or all the values in a column, ignoring any filters that might have been applied. value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: Creating Calendar Table in Power BI using DAX Functions

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other.
